intro: Microtis formosana, commonly known as the Formosa microtis, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
